posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.55.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Keyboard shortcuts for emoji and stickers are back! These shortcuts also save even more time because now you won’t need to write in and tell us that they’re broken anymore.
  • We also fixed a crash on Linux distributions that don’t support GTK4 yet.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.54.0-beta.1…v7.55.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

New Version: 7.55.0-beta.1

58 new commits since 7.54.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.55.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Update staged link preview styles [2]

  • Translate emoji completions in composer [3]

  • Fix link previews in forward modal [4]

  • Delay provisioner socket connection [5]

  • Remove already enabled blink features [6]

  • Send window activation from tray icon as well [7]

  • Simplify service id checks in MessageReceiver [8]

  • Fix some backup export issues [9]

  • Spread the update downloads over 6 hours [10]

  • Add tooltips to fun picker [11]

  • Additional fixes for backup validator [12]

  • Shutdown: Don't hang up ringing incoming calls [13]

  • Manually hoist all eslint config and plugin modules [14]

  • Username search: Trim leading/trailing whitespace beforehand [15]

  • Update @signalapp/sqlcipher to 2.0.1 [16]

  • Set CI=true in reproducible build [17]

  • Update electron-builder to 26.0.14 [18]

  • Upgrade to React 18 [19]

  • Reset expire timer version after unlink [20]

  • Upgrade react in sticker-creator [21]

  • Fix localized emoji auto-completions [22]

  • Update README for reproducible-builds [23]

  • Update release notes [24]

  • Update strings [25]

  • Update DNS fallback [26]

  • Fix conversation view from getting stale data [27]

  • Optimize publicKey deserialization for server trust root [28]

  • Upgrade libsignal to v0.71.0 [29]

  • Fix backup validation errors [30]

  • Bump electron from 35.1.4 to 36.0.1 [31]

  • Better update handling on Linux [32]

  • Throttle unread updates [33]

  • Add workaround to fix Linux GTK version for electron [34]

  • Introduce infrastructure for Notification Profiles [35]

  • Fix mismatching gif response byte length [36]

  • Better context menu on macOS [37]

  • Display emoji completions with diacritics [38]

  • Fix camera state after screen sharing [39]

  • Notification Profiles: Ensure recently-created profiles always take precedence [40]

  • Attribute exported group updates to local ACI [41]

  • makeHttpError: Ensure response headers have lowercase names [42]

  • Add backdrop blur to image grid download button [43]

  • Basic support for local encrypted backups [44]

  • Add content protection checkbox to Settings window [45]

  • Add keyboard shortcuts to fun picker [46]

  • Scope down content protection to Windows 11 [47]

  • Improve reaction targeting [48]

  • Fix runtime error in nickname equality check [49]

  • Fix state after backup integration tests [50]

  • Don't drop about-to-disappear messages [51]

  • Run SQL corruption check on logic error [52]

  • Prefix sql read/write errors with method name [53]

  • Use frame-by-frame validator for testing [54]

  • Send and properly receive AttachmentPointer.uploadTimestamp [55]

  • Update release notes [56]

  • Update strings [57]

  • 7.55.0-beta.1 [58]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.54.0-beta.1…v7.55.0-beta.1

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked:
At the moment, sending two or more emojis separated by spaces causes the message to display as normal text message. However, if the same emojis are sent without any spaces, they appear correctly.

Desktop:

image0330×274 13.3 KB

Android:

image611×475 39.3 KB

New Version: 7.55.0-beta.2

5 new commits since 7.55.0-beta.1:

  • Scope down content protection further for now [1]

  • Fix gif download error with mismatching slice byte length [2]

  • Bump libsignal-client to v0.71.1 [3]

  • Update strings [4]

  • 7.55.0-beta.2 [5]

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked:
Can we get an option to disable “localized emojis”? The problem is that I’ve been typing emoji starting with a colon for years, but now I get different results. To give you an example or two, I type :fire and press enter, which has always resulted in , but now I get , or I type :raised, which has always been , and now I get . My friends so far share the same feedback.

Edit: I changed language of my Signal back to English, so at least that’s the solution for now.
